channel.title: Video advice
channel.description:
I am not entirely sure which board this fits in. In one sense it's graphics in another, it isn't so please move this if you see fit.
Long story short, Kieran and I are are making a gaming commentary/guide/general gaming youtube channel and I am not entirely sure exactly what I need to use/have no experience with video editing for the most part.
To make this the easiest on me I have made a mini layout you don't have to use it but well this is just how I am sort of layout minded I guess.
1) What programs to record with?
2) What programs can I use to record 1080p? (or at least 720p even though 1080 preferred)
3) What programs do I need to edit the videos? (these are going to be "professional" style edited videos so I know there will be practice involved in using the programs etc so please list the better ones don't just say windows movie maker if it can't help to do whatever I need it to do lol)
4) Any good tutorials you can link me to? :) I am always willing to learn!
5) I assume one of the programs from #3 would be used but... how do I make a youtube intro?
5) Any other advice you can supply?

item.title: Video advice
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:6, topic:530438”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=649198.msg4363574#msg4363574 date=1379209771]
Hm? Are you making a website also?
[/quote]

We plan to livestream and make a website at a later date. We first want to get some variety in gaming videos completed. We are still in very early stages at the moment.

[hr]

[quote author=chillwitm888 link=topic=649198.msg4363581#msg4363581 date=1379210511]
Dreamweaver? photoshop would be better for small frame edits. premiere is abit less user friendly than sony vegas but in my opinion perhaps more efficient.
I just use fraps or bandicam for recording. Camstasia is kinda useless to me
[/quote]like I mentioned earlier I have no prior experience with editing/recording that’s why the point of this topic. I have fraps but I have been told you can’t record longer than 10 minutes so that may be an issue in specific games?

I have… acquired premiere as well but I am unsure of how to do use any of the programs. I really need some good tutorials/guides to get started.[/quote]
what really?(i have used fraps on chrome, war3, star2,bf2,bf3, mirrors edge,rs2andrs3) I have 25 minute clips using fraps. thats about how long i game per session as i am not a hard core advocate of gaming.
Frap files are although, pretty large…

Read full topic

item.title: Video advice
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

eyeownyew:

Hm? Are you making a website also?

We plan to livestream and make a website at a later date. We first want to get some variety in gaming videos completed. We are still in very early stages at the moment.

[hr]

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:5, topic:530438”]Dreamweaver? photoshop would be better for small frame edits. premiere is abit less user friendly than sony vegas but in my opinion perhaps more efficient.
I just use fraps or bandicam for recording. Camstasia is kinda useless to me[/quote]like I mentioned earlier I have no prior experience with editing/recording that’s why the point of this topic. I have fraps but I have been told you can’t record longer than 10 minutes so that may be an issue in specific games?

I have… acquired premiere as well but I am unsure of how to do use any of the programs. I really need some good tutorials/guides to get started.

Read full topic

item.title: Video advice
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:2, topic:530438”]I’d recommend Sony Vegas. It’s very professional. [size=1pt]pirate it[/size]
I use Camtasia to record, it works pretty well, records in 1080p[/quote]mmkay so you use camtasia to record in the 1080p itself and then you use sony vegas to do the edits.

Thanks for the information.

I’ve been doing a lot of research and people are saying that I need like

-sony vegas ( already have )
-after effects ( gonna …acquire it…)
-dreamweaver ( gonna…acquire it…)

Read full topic

item.title: Video advice
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

I’d recommend Sony Vegas. It’s very professional. [size=1pt]pirate it[/size]
I use Camtasia to record, it works pretty well, records in 1080p
